page.title: 02Recreation in Whipsnade
page.content: Parishioners of Whipsnade depend on their own hobbies to use up leisure time. There are no established recreational sports or games. The younger generations can go to other parishes or towns' Leisure Centres but depend mainly on their parents for transport by car. The adults have their homes and gardens to tend, Women's Institute and Flower Group. All ages can watch television and videos, listen to the radio, walk the family dog on the Common and National Trust Land, visit the Zoo, the Tree Cathedral, go over the Downs to play golf, or ride horses on the bridle paths. To raise Funds for charities there are Church Fetes, Social Functions, Bingo Evenings, Whist Drives, Jumble Sales, Flea Markets and Coffee Mornings.
